title: 115_s875
content: The curr_chunk is about studying and reporting on filing requirements under universal service fund programs. The curr_chunk defines key terms related to universal service fund programs, including the Administrative Procedure Act, the Commission (Federal Communications Commission), covered carrier, and Universal Service Fund program. The curr_chunk discusses various programs under the Universal Service Fund, including Lifeline, E-Rate, Rural Health Care, Remote Areas Fund, Connect America Fund, Mobility Fund, and High Cost Loop Support. The Comptroller General of the United States is required to study and report on these programs within 18 months of the Act's enactment. The Comptroller General of the United States will conduct a study on filing requirements for covered carriers in the Universal Service Fund program, analyze their financial impact, and make recommendations on consolidating redundant filing requirements. The Commission must initiate a rulemaking within 60 days of the report submission to consolidate redundant filing requirements for covered carriers in the Universal Service Fund program. This includes incorporating recommendations from the study on filing requirements conducted by the Comptroller General. The Commission must initiate a rulemaking to consolidate redundant filing requirements for covered carriers in the Universal Service Fund program. This includes seeking comment on recommendations and considering the potential risks of waste, fraud, and abuse in the program. The Commission must complete a rulemaking to consolidate redundant filing requirements for covered carriers participating in the Universal Service Fund program. The Senate passed the bill on January 10, 2018, as attested by Secretary JULIE E. ADAMS.
